result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montel C Cooper

records.addlTxt: Due to defendants compliance with the terms of the agreement, parties requested to cancel the midpoint review hearing. Court scheduled the final review hearing with parties.
Received and Filed, Montel Cooper Notice of Completion

Defendant Montel C Cooper in court with Attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.  Court holds colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to appear in person before the Court. Court finds the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives his right to appear in person before the Court and agrees to proceed electronically via Zoom/live on DACAST.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.  Deferred Agreement, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed.  Terms of the agreement stated on the record. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant was examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint.  Court approved the deferred agreement and WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  

All parties notified that this case will be assigned to Judge Cynthia Davis, Branch 21.  Court set a review hearing date.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  Deferred Prosecution Agreement

Defendant Montel C Cooper in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. . 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. 
Discussion held.  Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State and request a dpa hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be streamed lived on Dacast -via zoom.
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Montel C Cooper in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and potential dpa offer and request time for defendant to have a tad evaluation done. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Montel C Cooper in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/06/2022@1:30pm
